an7.7:4.1: Then Ugga the government minister went up to the Buddha,
an7.7:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an7.7:5.2: Migāra of Rohaṇa is so rich, so very wealthy.”
an7.7:5.4: “He has a hundred thousand gold coins, not to mention the silver!”
an7.7:5.5: “Well, Ugga, that is wealth, I can’t deny it.
an7.7:5.6: But fire, water, rulers, thieves, and unloved heirs all take a share of that wealth.
an7.7:5.7: There are these seven kinds of wealth that they can’t take a share of.
an7.7:5.9: The wealth of faith, ethical conduct, conscience, prudence, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
an7.7:5.10: There are these seven kinds of wealth that fire, water, rulers, thieves, and unloved heirs can’t take a share of.”
an7.7:6.1: “Faith and ethical conduct are kinds of wealth,
an7.7:6.4: and wisdom is the seventh kind of wealth.
an7.7:7.3: they’re really rich in the world,
an7.7:8.3: should be committed to faith and ethical conduct,
